entries.meaning: A visual art form from Maharashtra, India, involving singing and dancing.
examples: We had fine clothes, and feasting, and drum-beating, and fireworks let off in our village. It was a grand tamasha!

entries.meaning: (colonial India, historical) Any traditional indigenous public ceremony.
examples: I went to a Tamasha, as the Indian troops call these affairs, one fine Sunday afternoon in May. A broad plateau in the middle of the fields had been selected for the sports, and when I arrived an enormous crowd, as picturesque as any I have ever seen, was thronging round the ropes.
